issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description:
HiistoryView#printCounters method uses AbstractCounter#getGroupNames, which includes legacy groups can cause duplicates on CLI output.

See attached example output.
fields.summary: hadoop/mapred job -history <history_file> shows the counters twice in the output.

comments.body:

This message was automatically generated.
Renamed the patch to run jenkins against branch-2.7.
Hi [~aaperezl], thank you for creating the patch. Would you please rebase the patch for trunk?

bq. fgroups.containsKey(newGroup) and groups.containsKey(newGroup)) should be !fgroups.containsKey(newGroup) and !groups.containsKey(newGroup)), respectively
Sorry, my bad. This changes breaks TestCounters#testLegacyGetGroupsNames.

This message was automatically generated.
So do you think that instead of using what the current patch is doing, we should change what the actual {{AbstractCounter#getGroupNames}} returns?

bq. So do you think that instead of using what the current patch is doing, we should change what the actual AbstractCounter#getGroupNames returns?
Yes. That way we can avoid duplicate entries for JSONHistoryViewerPrinter as well. The current patch ignores all of the deprecated counter name.

The thing is that TestCounters#testLegacyGetGroupsNames is actually expecting to find duplicates (because is expecting to find the group name + the legacy name of the same group), so modifying AbstractCounters#getGroupNames so it doesn't return duplicates will always make that tests fail.
